oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Fort Wayne, Indiana congregation service, undated
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hood, Ralph W.; Williamson, W. Paul (William Paul)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Video recording opening with a member of the church playing guitar. The music and singing continues and is only briefly interrupted by a member of the church speaking before beginning again. As the music continues a member of the congregation removes several serpents from their enclosure and dances as he handles them. The music lulls and a man speaks to members of the church and testifies. When he is done, music and serpent handling begin again. Another lull in the music reveals a man speaking in tongues before another singer comes forward. Members come forward to pray at the altar and several lay hands on one another as they come forward. Though the music continues, one man holds a microphone and testifies. He is incomprehensible due to the poor sound quality and music. Another member of the church stands as the pulpit and testifies during a brief pause in song. He follows his testimony with song. Another member testifies during a final lull in the music. His testimony and a final set of songs end the recording.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Appalachian Region, Southern -- Religious life and customs; Dance -- Religious aspects; Glossolalia; Imposition of hands; Singing -- Religious aspects; Snake cults (Holiness churches) -- Appalachian Region, Southern; Witness bearing (Christianity)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Ralph W. Hood and W. Paul Williamson field recordings, interviews, and photographs
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Ralph W. Hood and W. Paul Williamson Holiness Churches of Appalachia recordings and interviews
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:rightsHolder: Hood, Ralph W.; Williamson, W. Paul (William Paul)
